Line 53: Line 53:
On June 29th, 2005, "TransitMan" [http://kmeleon.sourceforge.net/forum/read.php?f=1&i=27783&t=27743#reply_27784 updated the K-Ninja rendering engine] to Gecko 1.7.9 beta, and since March 12th, 2006, "Al." (a former K-Meleon dev) updated it further and began to maintain it on a new homepage as K-Ninja Samurai v1.x, with the v1.7.13 Gecko engine. On October 27th, 2007 he released [http://geocities.com/grenleef K-Ninja v2.1.4.5], using the rendering engine of Seamonkey v1.1.5 (currently rv: 1.8.1.8).<ref>[http://geocities.com/grenleef K-Ninja changelog], K-Ninja website</ref>
On June 29th, 2005, "TransitMan" [http://kmeleon.sourceforge.net/forum/read.php?f=1&i=27783&t=27743#reply_27784 updated the K-Ninja rendering engine] to Gecko 1.7.9 beta, and since March 12th, 2006, "Al." (a former K-Meleon dev) updated it further and began to maintain it on a new homepage as K-Ninja Samurai v1.x, with the v1.7.13 Gecko engine. On October 27th, 2007 he released [http://geocities.com/grenleef K-Ninja v2.1.4.5], using the rendering engine of Seamonkey v1.1.5 (currently rv: 1.8.1.8).<ref>[http://geocities.com/grenleef K-Ninja changelog], K-Ninja website</ref>
â
Current K-Ninja development has been scaled down by Al. because of personal commitments and also as he began using [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu Linux]]. Further updates only occurred when new GREs were released, which ensured browser security.
+
Current K-Ninja development has been scaled down by Al. because of personal commitments and also as he began using [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]]. Further updates only occurred when new GREs were released, which ensured browser security.
The last couple of K-Ninja releases were done privately as a service to existing K-Ninja users reluctant to switch to another browser. The last release was K-Ninja v2.2.1 (codenamed Cydonia based on Gecko v1.8.1.12). An experimental version using the older Gecko v1.8.0.14pre rendering engine was also developed during this period, it being called "Orbital".
The last couple of K-Ninja releases were done privately as a service to existing K-Ninja users reluctant to switch to another browser. The last release was K-Ninja v2.2.1 (codenamed Cydonia based on Gecko v1.8.1.12). An experimental version using the older Gecko v1.8.0.14pre rendering engine was also developed during this period, it being called "Orbital".
